law.catch_line: Criminal possession of a forged prescription.

text.section: A person is guilty of criminal possession of a forged prescription when, with knowledge that it is forged and with intent to defraud, deceive, or injure another, he possesses a forged prescription.

Criminal possession of a forged prescription is:
For a first offense, a Class A misdemeanor.
For second or subsequent offense, a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 301, sec. 5, effective July 15, 1998.
